subject: Re: [junit] Testing classloader isolation?
msgSnippet: On Tue, 21 Sep 2004 21:29:51 +0200, Stefan Bodewig ... which is not all that difficult to do using ant 1.6, but we are still stuck at 1.5.1... I don t want to
messageBody:
On Tue, 21 Sep 2004 21:29:51 +0200, Stefan Bodewig
<stefan.bodewig@...> wrote:
> Until we have isolates in the Java VM the only alternative to
> non-delegating classloaders I can think of is forking a new Java VM.
>
> Since you are concerned about your client using classes from the
> server, but no the other way around, it may be enough to run the
> client in a separate VM that doesn't contain the server jar in its
> classpath.

which is not all that difficult to do using ant 1.6, but we are still
stuck at 1.5.1... I don't want to have to duplicate the subprocess
management stuff if I can avoid it
